intro: Collinsia torreyi var. linearis, commonly known as the slender hill's clock, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of California. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
